name: Native Medicare Charitable Trust
briefDescription: Native Medicare Charitable Trust (NMCT) is a non profit service organisation serving the most vulnerable community like Tribes, Rural women, HIV/AIDS infected families, orphan and semi orphan children, migrants and children in need.1. Sustainable livelihood for the Tribes: 300 tribal families supported for wadi (orchard farming) and 450 families are supported with livelihood activity ( sheep rearing, milch animals, petti shops, tailoring etc.,)	2. Empowering Rural Women: Over 1000 women are supported for micro entrepreneurship activities by formation of self help groups3. Care and Support for people and children infected by HIV/AIDS: 860 families are provided with treatment services, nutrition food package, emergency services, income generating activities, capacity building training etc	4. Support for orphan / semi â€“ orphan children: 26 children are provided with protective care, nutrition food, quality education and medical care in the Abhaya Students Shelter5. Prevention of HIV/AIDS: Over 75000 migrant industrial workers have been given awareness and supported for treatment services through linkages e6. Nutrition education: 4500 children and 18000 women group including adolescent girls and pregnant women are given awareness on nutrition food, developing kitchen garden in their homes and health and hygiene to the children in schools and community 7. Silai School : 170 silai schools and 230 satellite silai schools have been established with the partnership of Usha International Ltd for empowering poor women and girls in tailoring and garment making
